elements.name: willIntroExplanation
elements.title:
This step in the service will ask if {deceasedName} made a `Will` or any `other testamentary documents`.

The questions in this step will be very technical. Please read the content carefully. This step may be the most complicated one in this service. This service will likely feel easier after this step.

If {deceasedName} made a Will, there will be a lot of questions about the Will. These questions help prove to the Court that {deceasedName}'s Will represents how {deceasedName} wants their belongings managed.

elements.name: willCheck
elements.title: Have you looked for {deceasedName}'s Will?
elements.description:
This means checking all the places where {deceasedName} kept important documents.

Physical places include their home, safety deposit box, and their lawyer's office.

Electronic places include their smart phone, computer, external hard drive, and cloud storage.

elements.name: willCheckFAQ1
elements.title: Do I have look for {deceasedName}'s Will all by myself?
elements.body:
The person applying for a `Representation Grant` has to look for {deceasedName}'s Will.

If several people are applying together for a Representation Grant, you can decide which `applicant` looks where.

elements.name: willCheckFAQ2
elements.title: Do I have to get a "Search of Wills Notice" right now?
elements.body:
A "Search of Wills Notice" is a document from the Vital Statistics Agency of British Columbia that can tell you where to find a Will.

You will need a "Search of Wills Notice" as part of your Representation Grant `application`. You can get a "Search of Wills Notice" on your own at anytime, or you can wait for this service to help you get this document in a later step.

The reason this service helps you with a "Search of Wills Notice" in a later step is because it needs to include all of the different names and spellings that {deceasedName} used in their Will and for their `assets`.

If you believe {deceasedName} made a Will and you feel you need help finding it now, you may consider getting a "Search of Wills Notice" right now. If you get this document on your own, this service will check that it was done correctly.

If you want to get a "Search of Wills Notice" right now, click here to download a blank form.

elements.name: willCheckNoError
elements.title:
You are responsible for making sure if {deceasedName} made a Will or not.

Please look in all the places where {deceasedName} kept important documents.

Physical places include their home, safety deposit box, and their lawyer's office.

Electronic places include their smart phone, computer, external hard drive, and cloud storage.

If you believe {deceasedName} made a Will and you feel you need help finding it, click "Do I have to get a "Search of Wills Notice" right now?". (This can be found right above)

elements.name: willGrantExistsIntro
elements.title:
Next, we need to figure out if a Representation Grant for {deceasedName} already exists.

If a Representation Grant for {deceasedName} already exists, this service will ask different questions to complete your application.

elements.name: willGrantExists
elements.title: Does a Representation Grant for {deceasedName} already exist?
elements.description: For example, someone might have gotten a Representation Grant for good other one in another province or another country. In this case, the document from another province or country may not be called a Representation Grant but it will have the same purpose.

elements.name: willGrantExistsFAQ1
elements.title: What if I believe a Representation Grant for {deceasedName} already exists but I/we cannot find it?
elements.body:
If you believe a Representation Grant for {deceasedName} already exists, this service cannot help you apply for a Representation Grant at this point in time.

For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations. Select "Yes" for the question above to see the next steps that you can take. You will need to take these steps on your own without this service.

elements.name: willGrantExistsNoErrorCurrent
elements.title:
For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations. At this point in time, this service cannot help you apply for a Representation Grant.

If the existing Representation Grant is from British Columbia, and you need to add a new person onto the Representation Grant, please talk to a lawyer. This is not a simple matter.

If the existing Representation Grant is from British Columbia, and you have more `assets` to report, stop using this service. Use either form P14 or P15 to tell the court. Forms P14 and P15 can be found here.

If the existing Representation Grant is from a British Commonwealth country, the United States of America or Hong Kong, the existing Representation Grant can be resealed. Please refer to the Supreme Court Civil Rules under Rule 25-6 - Application for Resealing for information on resealing the Representation Grant.

If the existing Representation Grant is not from a British Commonwealth country, the United States of America or Hong Kong, you will have to apply for an ancillary Representation Grant. The forms to apply for an ancillary grant can be found here.

elements.name: willExists
elements.title: Did {deceasedName} make a Will?

elements.name: willExistsFAQ1
elements.title: What if I believe {deceasedName} made a Will but I/we cannot find it?
elements.body:
If you cannot find {deceasedName}'s Will, you can keep looking for it or you can decide to apply for a Representation Grant as if {deceasedName} did not make a Will.

If you decide to apply for a Representation Grant as if {deceasedName} did not make a Will, Select "No" to this question. If you find {deceasedName}'s Will after you already got your Representation Grant, you can apply for a new Representation Grant using their Will to replace the old one.

If you believe {deceasedName} made a Will and you decide to keep looking for it, this service cannot help you apply for a Representation Grant at this time. For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations.

The Government of British Columbia offers PDF forms that you may find helpful for applications where {deceasedName} made a Will. Click here to go to the forms. (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: willExistsFAQ2
elements.title: What if {deceasedName} started making a Will but never finished it?
elements.body:
If {deceasedName} started making a Will, but never finished it, and you want to use this document Will as part of your application for a Representation Grant, this service cannot help you apply at this time.

For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations.

The Government of British Columbia offers PDF forms that you may find helpful for applications where {deceasedName} made a Will, including unfinished Wills. Click here to go to the forms. (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: willExistsYesError
elements.title:
If you believe {deceasedName} made a Will, this service cannot help you apply for a Representation Grant at this time.

For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations.

The Government of British Columbia offers PDF forms that you may find helpful for your application. Click here to go to the forms. (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: willOtherDocExists
elements.title: Did {deceasedName} make any `other testamentary documents` with information about how they want their belongings to be managed after they died?
elements.description:
Other testamentary documents may include:
  • unfinished Wills,
  • email conversations,
  • text messages,
  • diary or journal entries,
  • any other written document with information about {deceasedName}'s intentions for their belongings.

elements.name: willOtherDocRecognize
elements.title: Do you want to have these other testamentary documents recognized as {deceasedName}'s Will?

elements.name: willOtherDocRecognizeYesError
elements.title:
If you want to have an other testamentary document recognized as {deceasedName}'s Will, this service cannot help you apply for a Representation Grant at this time.

For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations.

The Government of British Columbia offers PDF forms that you may find helpful for your application. Click here to go to the forms. (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: willOtherDocRecognizeNoReasonsFinishedNoError
elements.title: Keep listing `other testamentary documents` until you are finished and then select "Yes". Click on "Add other testamentary document" to list another document.

elements.name: willP5NoWillNoOtherDocExplanation
elements.title:
Because {deceasedName} did not make a Will or any other testamentary document, you can move on to the next step.

The next step is to identify the people in {deceasedName}'s life who need to know that you are applying for a Representation Grant. This service will start by asking if {deceasedName} had a spouse or any children.
